data.enText: liquid/gas
to take in a liquid, gas or other substance from the surface or space around
Plants absorb oxygen.
The cream is easily absorbed into the skin.
make part of sth larger
to make sth smaller become part of sth larger

data.chText: 四周的小城镇已并入这座城市。
data.enText: The surrounding small towns have been absorbed into the city.

data.chText: 这个国家实在没有能力接纳这么多涌入的难民。
data.enText: The country simply cannot absorb this influx of refugees.
information
to take sth into the mind and learn or understand it

data.chText: 要一下子消化这么多资料，真是很难。
data.enText: It's a lot of information to absorb all at once.
interest sb

data.chText: 吸引全部注意力；使全神贯注
data.enText: to interest sb very much so that they pay no attention to anything else

data.chText: 这项工作曾使他沉迷了好几年。
data.enText: This work had absorbed him for several years.
heat/light/energy
to take in and keep heat, light, energy, etc. instead of reflecting it

data.chText: 黑色墙壁在白天吸收大量的热。
data.enText: Black walls absorb a lot of heat during the day.
shock/impact

data.chText: 减轻（打击、碰击等的）作用
data.enText: to reduce the effect of a blow, hit, etc.

data.chText: 这个网球拍能减轻撞击所产生的剧烈震动。
data.enText: This tennis racket absorbs shock on impact.
money/time/changes

data.chText: 耗费，耗去（大量金钱、时间等）
data.enText: to use up a large supply of sth, especially money or time

data.chText: 这些新提案将耗费800亿元联邦政府预算。
data.enText: The new proposals would absorb $80 billion of the federal budget.

data.chText: 承受，承担，对付（变化、结果、费用等）
data.enText: to deal with changes, effects, costs, etc.

data.chText: 公司无法承担如此巨大的亏损。
data.enText: The company is unable to absorb such huge losses.

simple_means.memory_skill: ab 去掉，离去 + sorb 吸收 → 吸收掉 → 吸收

ex.chText: 植物从空气中吸取水分。
ex.enText: Plants absorb moisture from the air.

synonyms.bx: 指吸收液体、气体、光、热等，或吸取知识、信息等。

ex.chText: 董事会需要时间来吃透这些信息。
ex.enText: The board will need time to assimilate the information.

ex.chText: 你读的东西都能消化理解吗？
ex.enText: Can you assimilate what you've read?

synonyms.bx: 强调透彻理解观点或信息。

ex.chText: 他受到了自己家庭传统的影响。
ex.enText: He had imbibed the traditions of his family.

ex.chText: 年轻人从长辈那里吸取智慧。
ex.enText: Youngsters imbibe wisdom from their elders.

synonyms.bx: 指接受品质、观点、价值等并受到影响。

example: The sales tax is absorbed into the state income tax

tr: consume all of one's attention or time
example: Her interest in butterflies absorbs her completely
He immersed himself into his studies
he absorbed the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe
The immigrants were quickly absorbed into society
She drew strength from the minister's words
The liquids, light, and gases absorb

tr: take up, as of debts or payments
suck or take up or in
example: A black star absorbs all matter

value.def: If something absorbs a liquid, gas, or other substance, it soaks it up or takes it in.

example.ex: Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the air and moisture from the soil...
example.tran: 植物从空气中吸收二氧化碳并从土壤中汲取水分。

example.ex: Refined sugars are absorbed into the bloodstream very quickly.
example.tran: 精制糖迅速吸收进血液中。

value.def: If something absorbs light, heat, or another form of energy, it takes it in.

example.ex: A household radiator absorbs energy in the form of electric current and releases it in the form of heat.
example.tran: 家用取暖器吸收电流能量，再以热量的形式释放出来。

value.def: If a group is absorbed into a larger group, it becomes part of the larger group.

example.ex: The Colonial Office was absorbed into the Foreign Office.
example.tran: 殖民部被并入了外交部。

example.ex: ...an economy capable of absorbing thousands of immigrants.
example.tran: 能够吸纳数千移民的经济实体

value.def: If something absorbs a force or shock, it reduces its effect.

example.ex: ...footwear which does not absorb the impact of the foot striking the ground.
example.tran: 不具备减震功能的鞋子

value.def: If a system or society absorbs changes, effects, or costs, it is able to deal with them.

example.ex: The banks would be forced to absorb large losses...
example.tran: 银行将被迫承受巨大的损失。
我们负担不起那些费用。

value.tran: 经受，承受（变革、影响等）；承担（费用等）

value.def: If something absorbs something valuable such as money, space, or time, it uses up a great deal of it.

example.ex: It absorbed vast amounts of capital that could have been used for investment...
example.tran: 它消耗掉了原本可用于投资的大笔资金。

example.ex: It might help if campaigning didn't absorb so much time and money.
example.tran: 如果竞选活动没耗费这么多的时间和金钱，情况或许还不会这么糟。

value.tran: 用掉，花掉（大量金钱）；占去（空间、时间）

value.def: If you absorb information, you learn and understand it.

example.ex: Too often he only absorbs half the information in the manual...
example.tran: 他对于说明书上所说的经常是一知半解。

example.ex: We closed our offices at 2:00 p.m. to give employees time to absorb the bad news.
example.tran: 我们下午两点就放工了，以便给员工时间来慢慢接受这一坏消息。

value.def: If something absorbs you, it interests you a great deal and takes up all your attention and energy.

example.ex: ...a second career which absorbed her more completely than her acting ever had.
example.tran: 比演艺生涯更让她投入的又一职业

value.tran: 吸引…的注意；使全神贯注

partsOfSpeech.dec: ab 相反 + normal 正常的 → 反常的
abs 相反 + ent 存在 → 不在 → 缺席的
abs 相反 + tain 拿住 → 不拿 → 戒绝
abs 相反 + tin 拿住 + ence 表状态 → 不让拿 → 节制；禁欲
abs 相反 + trus 推，冲 + e →〔思维〕冲不进 → 难懂的
ab 相反 + use 用 → 不〔正常〕使用 → 滥用
ab 去掉，离去 + dic 说话 + ate 使… → 离开说话的位置 → 退位
ab 去掉，离去 + duct 引导 → 引走 → 诱拐
ab 去掉，离去 + ject 扔 → 被人扔掉 → 可怜的
ab 去掉，离去 + jur 发誓 + e → 发誓离开 → 发誓，〔承诺〕放弃
ab 去掉，离去 + rad 擦 + e → 擦掉 → 磨损
ab 去掉，离去 + rog 要求 + ate 做，造成，使… → 要求离开 → 废除
ab 去掉，离去 + rupt 断 → 突然断开 → 突然的
abs 去掉，离去 + cis 切 + e → 切掉 → 切除
ab 去掉，离去 + sorb 吸收 → 吸收掉 → 吸收
abs 去掉，离去 + tract 拉 → 将[具体意义]抽走 → 抽象的
